  • Constructor Details

    • SingleRoute

      public SingleRoute(List<Edge> edges)
      The constructor of a single route. It makes a copy of the edges, in order to ensure the immutability. It also creates a table with the correct position at the index of the point. And it calculates the length at the same time.
      Parameters:
      edges - the edges that compose the route

    • points

      public List<PointCh> points()
      Return the points that compose the route. For doing that, we are taking the first node of every edges, and the last node of the last edge, in order to be sure to have no duplicate.
      Specified by:
      points in interface Route
      Returns:
      the points that compose the route

    • pointAt

      public PointCh pointAt(double position)
      Return the point at a certain position in the route. First, we make sure that the position is in the range, then we are doing the search of the index, to have the edge at a certain position. Finally, we are looking at the point at the position minus the position of the first node, to be sure to not exceed the length of the edge.
      Specified by:
      pointAt in interface Route
      Parameters:
      position - the position in the route
      Returns:
      the point at the given position on the route

    • elevationAt

      public double elevationAt(double position)
      Return the elevation at a certain position in the route. First, we make sure that the position is in the range, then we are doing the search of the index, to have the edge at a certain position. We are also looking at the profile and return a Double.NaN if the edge doesn't have an edge. Otherwise, we are looking at the elevation at the position minus the position of the first node, to be sure to not exceed the length of the edge.
      Specified by:
      elevationAt in interface Route
      Parameters:
      position - on the route
      Returns:
      the elevation at the given position

    • nodeClosestTo

      public int nodeClosestTo(double position)
      Return the closest node of a certain position in the route. First, we make sure that the position is in the range, then we are doing the search of the index, to have the edge at a certain position. Then we are looking at, whether the point is closer to the first or last node of the edge
      Specified by:
      nodeClosestTo in interface Route
      Parameters:
      position - on the route
      Returns:
      the closest node to the position

    • pointClosestTo

      public RoutePoint pointClosestTo(PointCh point)
      For this method, we look through all the edges, and we use the RoutePoint.min method, in order to have the closest RoutePoint to the point.
      Specified by:
      pointClosestTo in interface Route
      Parameters:
      point - the given point
      Returns:
      the closest RoutePoint
